access.description: The registered URL redirects (301) from /health/regulatory/certified-health-it/ to /health/certified-health-it/. The page is a static HTML compliance hub with multiple accordion sections. The EHI Export section is inside a collapsed accordion labeled 'Read more about EHI Export' but the content is present in the DOM (hidden via aria-hidden), so curl retrieves it without JavaScript. Oracle's Akamai CDN requires a browser-like User-Agent header. Six downloadable files (2 PDFs + 2 ZIPs for Millennium, 2 PDFs for HDI) are linked inside the accordion in tabular format.

products.name: Oracle Health Millennium

product_context.description: Oracle Health Millennium (formerly Cerner Millennium) is one of the largest enterprise EHR platforms globally, deployed at thousands of hospitals and health systems. Oracle acquired Cerner Corporation in 2022 for $28.3 billion. The Millennium platform is a comprehensive health information system spanning clinical documentation (PowerChart, nursing, dynamic documentation, PowerForms), CPOE, pharmacy (PharmNet), laboratory (PathNet), radiology (RadNet), surgery (SurgiNet), oncology, behavioral health, women's health, patient portal with messaging and bill pay, comprehensive revenue cycle management (billing, claims, collections, charge services), scheduling, document imaging, multimedia storage (DICOM), care coordination and planning, referrals, and prior authorizations. The certified modules are all components of the broader Millennium platform, and the EHI export covers the entire Millennium database.

export_approach.description: Native database export — the gold standard. Oracle Health exports the actual Millennium production database in its native relational schema across four data sources: (1) Core Millennium EHR Database with 6,604 documented tables, exported as SQL DDL + INSERT statements for MySQL or Oracle databases; (2) Oracle Health Multimedia Storage with DICOM and non-DICOM files in native formats; (3) Oracle Health Document Imaging with scanned documents as native binary files; (4) Oracle Health Longitudinal Plan (One Plan) care planning data as CSV/JSON. For single-tenant systems, a full database copy is provided on customer-supplied encrypted hardware. For multi-tenant systems, SQL files are generated. The data model is version 2025.4.01, organized into 242 schema modules covering every major functional area.

documentation_quality.description: Exceptionally detailed documentation. The data model is provided as a browsable HTML site (version 2025.4.01, last updated January 16, 2025) with full table-level and column-level detail for all 6,604 tables. Each table includes: table name, description, column names, data types, nullability, column definitions, and relationship sections showing foreign key references. ERD diagrams are provided as images. The 242 schema modules are organized by functional area (e.g., dms_pft_billing, dms_scheduling, dms_clinical_events). Companion PDFs provide user instructions for consuming the export, including SQL load order, database configuration requirements, and mapping between storage systems. Document imaging and multimedia schemas are documented in separate PDFs with column definitions and XSD for annotations.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: Oracle Health Millennium's EHI export is among the most comprehensive in the industry. As a native database export of 6,604 tables across 242 schema modules, it covers effectively every data category stored by the platform. The export spans four separate storage systems (relational database, multimedia storage, document imaging, and care planning), ensuring that non-relational data like DICOM images, scanned documents, and care plans are also included. The billing/financial coverage is exceptionally deep with 145 PFT tables plus charge, claims, and revenue cycle schemas. Scheduling has 189 dedicated tables. Clinical data spans dozens of modules (pathology, radiology, surgery, pharmacy, etc.). Audit trails are well-represented with 65+ audit tables. The only minor gap is that patient portal secure messaging content tables are not clearly labeled in the data model, though they would be included if stored in the Millennium database. This is a textbook example of how EHI export should be done.

clinical.evidence: Comprehensive clinical coverage across dozens of modules: CLINICAL_EVENT and 30+ CE_* tables (results, blobs, coded results), ALLERGY (4 tables), DIAGNOSIS (10+ tables), extensive ORDERS system, MEDICATION tables, IMMUNIZATION (6 tables), PROBLEM (7 tables), PROCEDURE (12+ tables), vital signs, PathNet laboratory (dms_general_lab, dms_micro, dms_pathnet_* schemas), RadNet radiology (dms_radnet_* with 10 schema groups), SurgiNet surgery, oncology, behavioral health, women's health, nursing/charting, dynamic documentation, PowerForms. Schema modules include dms_clinical_events, dms_charting, dms_nursing___charting, dms_physician_documentat, dms_dictation_transcript, dms_structured_clinical, dms_social_history, dms_fhx_family_history.

secure_messages.evidence: Multiple messaging-related schema modules: dms_message_center (11 tables: MSG_FYI_ASSIGNMENT, MSG_FYI_FILTER, TASK_ACTIVITY, TASK_INTENDED_RECIPIENT, TASK_PUBLISH_QUEUE, TASK_SUBACTIVITY, EMAIL_INFO, MSG_LETTER_TEMPLATE), dms_msvc_messaging (13 tables: MESSAGING_AUDIT, MESSAGING_FAVORITES, MESSAGING_NOTIFY, SUBSCRIPTION, SUBSCRIPTION_FILTER_MSG), plus TASK_ACTIVITY_ASSIGNMENT and TASK_ACTIVITY_HISTORY for inbox/message tracking. The TASK_ACTIVITY system is Millennium's core inbox mechanism for clinician communications. Portal-specific tables include PP_AUDIT_EVENT and PERSON_PORTAL_INVITE. Patient-provider message content may be stored in TASK_ACTIVITY or in portal-specific application tables within the database; since the full database is exported, all message data stored therein would be included.

billing_financial.evidence: Exceptionally comprehensive: 145 PFT_* (Patient Financial Transaction) tables covering account management (PFT_ACCT_*), billing (PFT_BILL, PFT_BILL_ACTIVITY, PFT_BILL_SUMMARY), claims (PFT_BR_CLAIM_DETAIL, PFT_BR_CLAIM_STATUS_DETAIL), transactions/posting (PFT_TRANS_*, PFT_POSTING_*), AR/collections (PFT_BAD_DEBT_BAL, PFT_BALANCE), payment processing (PFT_AP_REFUND), dunning (PFT_DUNNING_MSG). Plus CHARGE tables (CHARGE, CHARGE_EVENT, CHARGE_BATCH, CHARGE_DESC_MASTER, CHARGE_MOD — 13 tables), CLAIM_TRANS_INFO, and multiple revenue cycle schemas (dms_revenue_cycle_core, dms_revenue_cycle_config, dms_encounter___revenue, dms_collections, dms_charge_services, dms_scm_accounting, dms_scm_contract, dms_scm_purchasing, dms_scm_transaction). Dollar amounts, CPT codes, modifiers, and full billing lifecycle present.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Thoroughly documented: HEALTH_PLAN (5 tables including HEALTH_PLAN_ALIAS, HEALTH_PLAN_INFO, HEALTH_PLAN_TIMELY_FILING), PERSON_PLAN_* (8 tables for patient-plan relationships, authorizations, profiles, history), ENCNTR_PLAN_* (14 tables for encounter-level plan data including ENCNTR_PLAN_ELIGIBILITY, ENCNTR_PLAN_ELIG_BENEFIT, ENCNTR_PLAN_AUTH_R, ENCNTR_PLAN_COB). Dedicated schemas: dms_benefits, dms_authorization (4 pages), dms_enterprise_eligibili (eligibility verification), dms_electronic_prior_aut (electronic prior authorization), dms_health_plan. Full insurance lifecycle from eligibility verification through authorization, benefits, COB, and claims.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Extensively covered with 189 SCH_* tables: SCH_APPT (appointments), SCH_APPT_BOOK, SCH_APPT_ACTION, SCH_APPT_COMP, SCH_BOOKING, SCH_ACTION, SCH_ACTIVITY, SCH_RESOURCE, SCH_SLOT, SCH_TEMPLATE, SCH_WAIT_LIST, plus extensive build/configuration tables. Three scheduling schemas: dms_scheduling, dms_scheduling_build, dms_scheduling_orders_in. Additionally 100+ ENCNTR_* (encounter) tables covering visit data, demographics, care management, classification, and billing information.

documents_images.evidence: Comprehensively covered across three dedicated storage systems: (1) Core database: BLOB_REFERENCE, CE_BLOB/CE_BLOB_RESULT/CE_BLOB_SUMMARY, 30+ CDI_* document imaging tables, dms_imaging_document schema, dms_digital_media_servic schema; (2) Oracle Health Document Imaging: separate content management database with AE_ADEFS, AE_DT#, AE_DL#, AE_RH# tables, binary files in native format (TIFF, JPEG, PDF), documented AxAnnotations.xsd for annotations; (3) Oracle Health Multimedia Storage: DICOM images (XML/JSON metadata + pixel data), non-DICOM files (audio, video, patient photos, reports) in native formats. Cross-referencing between multimedia and core database via DMS_MEDIA_IDENTIFIER table.

audit_trails.evidence: 65+ audit-related tables: AUDIT_EVENT, AUDIT_NAME_DEF, AUDIT_REQUEST, AUDIT_TYPE_DEF (core audit infrastructure), CE_AUDIT_LOG (clinical event audit), PP_AUDIT_EVENT (patient portal audit), MESSAGING_AUDIT, CHART_REQUEST_AUDIT, IMMUNIZATION_AUDIT, VISITCODING_AUDIT, CODING_AUDIT, ENTITY_LOCK_AUDIT, EPRESCRIBE_AUDIT, DM_AUDIT, DM_CHG_LOG_AUDIT, SI_AUDIT, SI_SPINE_AUDIT, TRACKING_AUDIT/TRACKING_AUDIT_ELEMENT. Dedicated dms_prologue schema (11 pages) for audit/logging infrastructure. 40+ _HISTORY tables track changes over time across multiple domains. Module-specific audit tables (ALERT_AUDIT_*, RX_*_AUDIT, etc.) provide granular audit trails for clinical alerts, pharmacy, and other subsystems.

issues: Patient portal secure messaging: While the Patient Portal is a certified module and TASK_ACTIVITY/MESSAGING tables exist, dedicated patient-to-provider message content tables are not clearly labeled in the data model. The full database export should include them if stored in the database, but explicit identification would improve transparency.

Documentation complexity: The 6,604-table data model lacks a comprehensive mapping guide explaining which tables serve which clinical functions. A receiving system would need significant Cerner/Millennium domain expertise to interpret the data.

Population export operational complexity: Single-tenant population exports require Oracle-licensed software for database restoration, customer-supplied encrypted hardware, and physical shipping — operationally complex compared to a simple file download.
Legacy naming: URLs still reference 'cerner-corp-' and internal documentation uses 'Cerner Millennium' naming, suggesting documentation has not been fully updated post-acquisition.
Value sets not documented: While table/column definitions are present, code set values (enumerations, allowed values for coded fields) are not explicitly documented in the data model reports.
products.summary: Oracle Health Millennium's EHI export is among the most comprehensive available — a native database export of 6,604 tables across 242 schema modules, covering four separate storage systems (relational database, multimedia storage, document imaging, care planning). All seven EHI categories are well-represented, with exceptional depth in billing (145 PFT tables), scheduling (189 SCH tables), and clinical data. This is a textbook example of the 'database dump' approach that maximizes completeness.

downloaded_files.description: Single Patient EHI Export Data Overview and User Instructions — describes ZIP structure, SQL file organization, and consumption instructions for single-patient exports
Single Patient EHI Export Data Format Specifications — contains EHI MYSQL DATA MODEL 2025401.zip (1,459 files, 6,604 table definitions as browsable HTML reports) and Longitudinal Plan EHI Export PDF

Patient Population EHI Export Data Overview and User Instructions — 23-page document covering four data sources (Core EHR, Multimedia Storage, Document Imaging, Longitudinal Plan), multi-tenant vs single-tenant delivery, and detailed consumption instructions

Patient Population EHI Export Data Format Specifications — contains MySQL and Oracle data model ZIPs (1,459 files each), Longitudinal Plan PDF, Document Imaging schema PDF, DICOM structure PDF, non-DICOM column definitions PDF, and AxAnnotations XSD

Oracle Health Data Intelligence (HDI) EHI Export Data Overview and User Instructions — describes API-based Longitudinal Record Bulk Extract for the HDI platform (separate product, not in our target CHPL IDs)

Oracle Health Data Intelligence (HDI) EHI Export Data Format Specifications — 124 Avro entity types for the HDI Longitudinal Record (Actor, Allergy, Appointment, BenefitPlan, Claim, Condition, Encounter, etc.)

summary: Oracle Health provides one of the most comprehensive EHI export implementations available. The Millennium platform's export is a native database dump of 6,604 tables across 242 schema modules, covering four separate storage systems (relational database, multimedia/DICOM storage, document imaging, and care planning). All seven EHI categories — clinical, messaging, billing, insurance, scheduling, documents, and audit — are substantively covered. The documentation is detailed with field-level definitions, data types, relationships, and ERD diagrams. This is the gold standard for EHI export: a full database dump with thorough documentation.
notes: The page also documents EHI export for Oracle Health Data Intelligence (HDI), a separate population health platform with its own CHPL entries. HDI uses an API-based export of Avro-schema JSON files with 124 entity types, which is supplementary to the Millennium database export. The HDI CHPL entries are not among our 10 target IDs, but the documentation was collected for completeness. Oracle's acquisition of Cerner (2022) means legacy naming persists throughout the documentation. The data model version is 2025.4.01, suggesting active maintenance.
